subject: This Week on Reliable Sources
body:
CNN.com










Coming up this Sunday on Reliable Sources: 

D.C. Madam: The story that wasn't

After
weeks of pumping up the idea that the DC Madam's clientele list
was full of big beltway names, ABC's 20/20, which had exclusive
rights to the list, didn't air any new names on the show this
Friday.  So what was this hype all about? and did ABC do the
right thing by releasing these names?

The GOP plays
"Hardball"  
In their first nationally televised
debate, Republican presidential hopefuls squared off with
MSNBC's Chris Matthews. Was he fair? Plus, how the media is
handling the political showdown over funding U.S. troops in
Iraq.

Murdoch's Expanding Empire

Rupert Murdoch makes a play for the Wall Street Journal.
Would the media moguls bid be good for the nation's largest
financial newspaper, or is this a case of bigger isn't always
better?

Plus,  Imus may not be leaving CBS
quietly.  The sharp-tongued media mogul's lawyer says he was
wrongly dismissed for his slur against the Rutger's women's
basketball team, and a fight over $40 million dollars is
brewing.  All that and more, on this week's Reliable Sources!

Join us this Sunday and every Sunday at 10am ET /
7am PT for our critical look at the media!
